info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 6:57PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Stillwater, north central Carbon, Yellowstone, Golden Valley and northeastern Sweet Grass Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 656 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 21 miles northeast of Big Timber to 8 miles northwest of Columbus to 9 miles southeast of Laurel. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph are possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Billings, Columbus, Laurel, Ryegate, Lockwood, Worden, Huntley, Shepherd, Billings Heights, Billings West End, Ballantine, Pryor, Broadview, Lavina, Franklin, Reed Point, Halfbreed Lake Wildlife, Pompeys Pillar, Silesia and Acton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for south central and central Montana.
